result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua T Chandler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Will be allowed huber and homemaker privilege

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR
Case settlement

Defendant Joshua T Chandler in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF186, 15CF187.  Agreement has been reached in all matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea in 15CF185, amended Ct in 15CF186.  15CF187 will be DRI.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE has complete an AODA assessment at Aurora.

State would like 30 days jail, consecutive in each case.
Atty would like sentence withheld, Probation.  


15CF185-DE will enter a plea of NC, court accepts and finds the DE guilty.  Withhold sentence, 5 years probation,  DE will serve 60 days jail, huber, homemaker privilege,  DE will pay CC, provide a DNA sample/surcharge and pay restititution of $500.00.

15CF186- Amend to Possession of Meth.  Withhold sentence, 3 years probation, concurrent to 15CF185.  NC, Court accepts and finds the DE guilty.   CC, DNA sample/surcharge.
